items.title: McCarthy delivers in debut, leads Vikings' rally
items.summary: In thrilling fashion Monday night, Minnesota quarterback J.J. McCarthy authored a late comeback, becoming the first quarterback in NFL history to account for three touchdowns in the fourth quarter of his NFL debut, as the Vikings outlasted the Bears.

items.title: Sources: Jaguars send Bigsby to Eagles for picks
items.summary: The Jacksonville Jaguars are trading running back Tank Bigsby, who had five carries for 12 yards Sunday in a win over the Carolina Panthers, to the Philadelphia Eagles in exchange for 2026 fifth- and sixth-round picks, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

items.title: Ben Johnson’s Chicago Bears offense ‘inconsistent’ as Caleb Williams loses his accuracy in loss to the Vikings
items.summary: Caleb Williams escaped the pocket to his left and saw green grass. The Chicago Bears quarterback sprinted at full speed toward the pylon. NFL Next Gen Stats clocked him over 20 miles per hour on the scramble, the fastest run of his young NFL career. Williams saw one man to beat, Minnesota Vikings cornerback Jeff Okudah, and he lowered his shoulder, brushed off the would-be tackler and found ...
